thread.title: The Voice's Kit Rice says Jennifer Hudson gave him a 'new lease of life'
thread.title_full: The Voice's Kit Rice says Jennifer Hudson gave him a 'new lease of life'

author: Emma Powell
title: The Voice's Kit Rice says Jennifer Hudson gave him a 'new lease of life'
text:
The Voice’s Kit Rice says Jennifer Hudson gave him a ‘new lease of life’ 
The singer-songwriter said he had an “amazing” experience on the ITV show Wednesday 1 March 2017 15:38 GMT Click to follow Sing for survival: Kit Rice on The Voice ITV 
Singer-songwriter Kit Rice has praised Jennifer Hudson for giving him a “new lease of life”. 
The 24-year-old was picked by Hudson on the latest series of The Voice after impressing her with his rendition of Bill Withers’ Ain't No Sunshine, but was booted off after she opted to save Jack Bruley in the battle round . 
Speaking to the Standard he said: “Jennifer Hudson has always been one of my vocal idols. I’ve watched Dream Girls a couple of hundred times. 
“It was amazing to sing for her, but for her to acknowledge me as a singer has given me a whole new lease of life and confidence.” Goodbye: Kit Rice with Jennifer Hudson on The Voice 
He continued: “I was completely star struck – and I don’t get star struck that often. I think I was stumbling over my words. She was lovely to me – it was a dream come true.” 
Rice – who toured with Ed Sheeran and Sir Tom Jones on graduating from the BRIT School – said he has received a number of “knockbacks” in the industry but has never considered turning hbis back on music. The Voice 2017 Launch - In pictures The Voice 2017 Launch - In pictures 1/10
